Posts.Title: Journey update

Posts.Content: Karl I had a biopsy in November. Cipro morning of biopsy then 3 days after. Biopsy was not to bad just a little uncomfortable. It's best to know what you have one way or the other. I actually wanted a biopsy before they would do it. As you can see I will have surgery in a little over a week. I'm a 3+4=7 but would it have been better 2 years ago who knows. Just find out and try to stay positive. I don't know about everyone else but I have good days and bad days worrying about it but mainly try to stay positive that it will be cured. I had no really bad effects from biopsy just watch you temperature for 72 hours is what they told me. If goes to 100 or 101 go to ER and tell them Sepsis. Good luck.

Posts.Title: Antibiotics for Biopsy and Question on DaVinci

Posts.Content: Hi Maximus. I am almost 6 weeks post surgery. I'm the same in that I don't feel the urge to pee. I can hold a fair amount in my bladder but when I start to leak quite a bit instead of the little dribble I go pee, usually a fair amount. I have asked the same question you did about not feeling the urge to pee here a couple of times but no one has ever answered so I guess no one else has experienced this. I asked my doctor about it and he said some of the nerves may have been injured but they should heal up. So far I still don't feel a real urge to pee. That's all I know about that.

Best wishes going forward. Try to relax and heal for now.

Posts.Content: I'm still trying to figure it out too. I'm 4 weeks post catheter 5 weeks post surgery. I use 1 to 2 diapers per night. I get up about every 2 hours to pee and go a lot like my bladder is full but don't have the old need to pee feeling so just go when I start leaking alot. Don't have to go much during the day use 1 pad most days and occasionally 2 pads. Anyway it's really frustrating for me trying to figure out how long to try to wait. Guess it will get better over time. Wanting to get as continent as possible as with my Pathology feel radiation is in my future.

Posts.Content: Thanks yolli71 good post as I was just diagnosed so starting the process for treatment. Saw your last post about doctor. I am kind of the same trying to decide on surgeon. Looking at Mayo Clinic in Phoenix, MD Anderson in Houston, or UNM in Albuquerque. The other 2 are bigger names than UNM but the doctor at UNM was recommended by my doctor and a couple of people here who had surgery done and they thought he was great. He is a Urologic Oncologist and Director of Robotic Surgery UNM and has done 700 or 800 surgeries over the last 10 years. It's a teaching hospital so he teaches other doctors how to do Da Vinci surgery. The thing about UNM is it's only 190 miles from my home while the others are 700 miles. Anyway was interesting to me to read your post on how you chose your doctor. Hope all keeps going well. ML

Posts.Content: It does seem they go slow at least for me.
Posts.Signature: DOB 1955 63 at dx 3/2018 PSA 4.05 DRE normal refer to URO small town 10/2018 PSA 6.28 DRE normal Biopsy 11/2018 12 cores 3 positive one 5% left mid two 50% left base Gleason 3+4=7 T1c Appt Mayo Clinic Phoenix Az 1/4/2019 Dr. Paul Andrews MRI Scheduled 2/27/2019 Mayo Phoenix AZ RALP Scheduled 2/28/2019 Mayo Phoenix AZ Dr. Paul Andrews Path: Gleason 3+4=7, Tertiary Gleason Pattern none, Grade Group 2 Tumor presents with moderate to extensive volume mainly on the posterior portion of prostate. The largest tumor nodule measures 8 mm. Prostate: 21g 3.5 x 3 x 3 cm Extraprostatic Extension: Absent Urinary Bladder Neck Invasion: Absent Seminal Vesicle Invasion: Positive (right seminal vesicle) Margins: Positive at left lateral base margin and central base margin 2mm focus each Lymph Nodes involved: 0 Lymph Nodes examined: 16 Nerves spared right side only Pathologic Staging (AJCC 8th Edition) Primary Tumor pT3b Regional lymph nodes: pNO Distant Metastasis: Mx
Posts.Title: Update on PC detection from my Urologist

Posts.Content: Mine was 45 minutes. Not very comfortable but if relax and stay still it's tolerable. They do put headphones on you to listen to music.
